alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 2:20AM CST until February 18 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Big Nance Creek at Courtland affecting Lawrence County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast. * WHERE...Big Nance Creek at Courtland. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, lowland flooding begins on the left bank of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM CST Saturday the stage was 14.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 AM CST Saturday was 14.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 02/24/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
